name: Oxygen
indications: Patient with dyspnea/shortness of breath, chest pain/discomfort presumed to be of cardiac etiology and/or with a SpO2 of <94%
Pediatric patient with asthma, reactive airway disease, bronchiolitis, croup and a SpO2 of < 92%
Preoxygenation prior to suctioning or intubation
Diving emergencies (pulmonary over pressure syndrome, arterial gas embolism, decompression sickness, nitrogen narcosis)
contraindications: Paraquat toxicity (may potentiate harmful superoxide formation)
Bleomycin use (may increase injury associated with pulmonary toxicity)
